meanings.definition: Bursting forth or breaking out suddenly and violently.
meanings.sent1: The volcano had an eruptive eruption, spewing hot lava everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The eruptive reaction of the chemicals caused a loud bang in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The eruptive popcorn in the microwave made a mess all over the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her eruptive temper flared up like a sudden storm, surprising everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The eruptive fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color and light.

meanings.definition: Characterized by eruptions or sudden outbursts.
meanings.sent1: The eruptive behavior of the toddler caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent2: Living near an eruptive volcano can be dangerous due to its unpredictable nature.
meanings.sent3: The eruptive laughter of the children filled the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent4: The eruptive music at the concert energized the crowd and got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent5: His eruptive creativity knew no bounds, constantly surprising those around him.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that erupts or causes an eruption.
meanings.sent1: The volcano is known as an eruptive due to its frequent explosions.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the eruptive to understand its behavior and patterns.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn machine was an eruptive during movie nights, always popping kernels non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The eruptive in the office was the boss, whose sudden outbursts kept everyone on edge.
meanings.sent5: The eruptive in the family was the youngest sibling, always causing chaos and excitement.
